data.Sentence_cn: 伸张正义
data.Sentence: --- lesson 35  Justice was done

data.Sentence_cn: “正义”这个词常常是同法庭连在一起的。
data.Sentence: The word justice is usually associated with courts of law.

data.Sentence_cn: 当某人被证据确凿地证明无罪或有罪的时候，我们也许会说正义得到了伸张。
data.Sentence: We might say that justice has been done when a man's innocence or guilt has been proved beyond doubt.

data.Sentence_cn: 正义是复杂的法律机器的组成部分。
data.Sentence: Justice is part of the complex machinery of the law.

data.Sentence_cn: 那些寻求正义的人走的是一条崎岖的道路，从来没有把握他们最终将找到正义。
data.Sentence: Those who seek it undertake an arduous journey and can never be sure that they will find it.

data.Sentence_cn: 法官无论如何聪明与有名，毕竟也是人，也会出差错的。
data.Sentence: Judges, however wise or eminent, are human and can make mistakes.

data.Sentence_cn: 在个别情况下，正义不再是一种抽象概念。
data.Sentence: There are rare instances when justice almost ceases to be an abstract concept.

data.Sentence_cn: 奖惩的实施是不受人的意志支配的。
data.Sentence: Reward or punishment are meted out quite independent of human interference.

data.Sentence_cn: 在这种时候，正义像一种有生命的力量行使其职能。
data.Sentence: At such times, justice acts like a living force.

data.Sentence_cn: 当我们说“他罪有应得”这句话的时候，
data.Sentence: When we use a phrase like 'it serves him right',

data.Sentence_cn: 我们部分地承认了某种特定的环境使得正义自动地起了作用。
data.Sentence: we are, in part, admitting that a certain set of circumstances has enabled justice to act of its own accord.

data.Sentence_cn: 一天上午，当一个小偷在一家大型珠宝店里被人抓住的时候，
data.Sentence: When a thief was caught on the premises of a large jewellery store one morning,

data.Sentence_cn: 店员一定会忍不住说：“他罪有应得。”
data.Sentence: the shop assistants must have found it impossible to resist the temptation to say 'it serves him right.'

data.Sentence_cn: 那是一座老式的、经过改造的房子，店里有许多废置不用的大壁炉和又高又窄的烟囱。
data.Sentence: The shop was an old converted house with many large, disused fireplaces and tall, narrow chimneys.

data.Sentence_cn: 快到中午的时候，一个女售货员听见从一堵墙里传出一种闷声闷气的叫声。
data.Sentence: Towards midday, a girl heard a muffled cry coming from behind one of the walls.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于这种喊叫声重复了几次，她跑去报告经理，经理当即给消防队挂了电话。
data.Sentence: As the cry was repeated several times, she ran to tell the manager who promptly rang up the fire brigade.

data.Sentence_cn: 喊叫声肯定是从烟囱里传出来的，
data.Sentence: The cry had certainly come from one of the chimneys,

data.Sentence_cn: 然而，因为烟囱太多，消防队员无法确定到底是哪一个。
data.Sentence: but as there were so many of them, the fire fighters could not be certain which one it was.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们通过叩击烟囱倾听那人的喊叫声而确定了传出声音的那个烟囱。
data.Sentence: They located the right chimney by tapping at the walls and listening for the man's cries.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们凿透了18英寸厚的墙壁，发现有个人卡在烟囱里。
data.Sentence: After chipping through a wall which was eighteen inches thick, they found that a man had been trapped in the chimney.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于烟囱太窄，那人无法动弹。
data.Sentence: As it was extremely narrow, the man was unable to move,

data.Sentence_cn: 消防队员在墙上挖了个大洞，才终于把他解救出来。
data.Sentence: but the fire fighters were eventually able to free him by cutting a huge hole in the wall.

data.Sentence_cn: 那个看起来满脸沮丧、浑身漆黑的家伙从烟囱里一出来，就承认头天夜里他企图到店里行窃，但让烟囱卡住了。
data.Sentence: The sorry-looking, blackened figure that emerged, admitted at once that he had tried to break into the shop during the night but had got stuck in the chimney.

data.Sentence_cn: 他已经在烟囱里被困了将近10个小时。
data.Sentence: He had been there for nearly ten hours.

data.Sentence_cn: 甚至在那人还没被送交给警察之前，正义就已得到了伸张。
data.Sentence: Justice had been done even before the man was handed over to the police.
